description: From Middle English disapeeren, equivalent to dis- +‎ appear. Displaced native Old English fordwīnan.

verbs.description: disappear (third-person singular simple present disappears, present participle disappearing, simple past and past participle disappeared)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To go missing; to become a missing person.
examples: Eighteen years after Jaycee Dugard disappeared in 1991, she was found alive in the summer of 2009.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To go away; to become lost.
(transitive) To make vanish; especially, to abduct and murder surreptitiously for political reasons.
examples: The Chinese government is well-known for disappearing particularly-vocal political dissidents.
